nl.bluejayeindhoven.bjcomm

Class Poller

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.bluejayeindhoven.bjcomm.Poller

  • public class Poller
extends java.lang.Object
    Implement simple poller that divides load between several channels

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Poller()
      Initializes a poller

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int add(CommunicationInterface comm)
      Adds an interface to the poller.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Poller

        public Poller()
        Initializes a poller

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public int add(CommunicationInterface comm)
        Adds an interface to the poller. Make sure the interface is loaded before adding it. Only add interfaces that support polling.
        Parameters:
        comm - interface to add to the poller
        Returns:
        identifier for the added interface or -1 if failed

      • poll

        public void poll()
        Poll all registered interfaces. Blocks until at least one of them has a message to process.
        Throws:
        CommunicationError - if an added interface is not started

      • hasMsg

        public boolean hasMsg(int id)
        Check if the supplied interface has a message to read
        Parameters:
        id - identifier of an interface returned by add method.
        Returns:
        if the interface has a message to read
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called before poll() is called
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if called with an invalid identifier
